item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "I am the last leaf on the tree, and the wind is blowing." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "I think the only way to get through this life is laughing hard and constantly, mostly at myself." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I know. In fact, I am never wrong." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "I do like the world quite a lot." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Humor is reason gone mad." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I've had a perfectly wonderful evening, but this wasn't it." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "I was under the stars, like a fish is under water." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Libba Bray
item.description: "You must remember, my dear lady, the most important rule of any successful illusion: First, the people must want to believe in it." -- Libba Bray

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Life is to be enjoyed, not endured" -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Good books are as friends, willing to give to us if we are willing to make a little effort." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "Stop seeking out the storms and enjoy more fully the sunlight." -- Gordon B. Hinckley

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "You are my butterfly and refuse to set you free." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "We don’t need a list of rights and wrongs, tables of dos and don’ts: we need books, time, and silence. <I>Thou shalt not</I> is soon forgotten, but <I>Once upon a time</I> lasts forever." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Ronald Reagan
item.description: "You can tell a lot about a fellow's character by his way of eating jellybeans. " -- Ronald Reagan

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: ". . . as long as there are movement and harmony, there are words." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Buddha
item.description: "Let us rise up and be thankful, for if we didn't learn a lot at least we learned a little, and if we didn't learn a little, at least we didn't get sick, and if we got sick, at least we didn't die; so, let us all be thankful." -- Buddha

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Shannon Hale
item.description: "Personally, I believe “Young Adult” to be an arbitrary title that means the book "Can be enjoyed by anyone/Has a main character who’s not quite an adult/Isn’t really boring." -- Shannon Hale

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Dean Hale
item.description: "It’s a tricky business, nurturing that aura of unapproachability." -- Dean Hale

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Joseph B. Wirthlin
item.description: "Each of us will have our own Fridays—those days when the universe itself seems shattered and the shards of our world lie littered about us in pieces. We all will experience those broken times when it seems we can never be put together again. We will all have our Fridays. But I testify to you in the name of the One who conquered death—Sunday will come. In the darkness of our sorrow, Sunday will come. No matter our desperation, no matter our grief, Sunday will come. In this life or the next, Sunday will come." -- Joseph B. Wirthlin

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Bree Despain
item.description: "The problem with promises is that you've made one, it's bound to be broken." -- Bree Despain

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: Enna Isilee (Squeaky Books) add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "By the pricking of my thumbs, Something wicked this way comes." -- William Shakespeare
